title: Paragon Software Group Named to Elite 2015 List of 20 Most Promising Disaster Recovery Solution Providers
text:
Leading IT-Focused Trade Publication Recognizes Paragon Protect & Restore Backup and Disaster Recovery Technology for Innovation, Customer Impact and Value
Irvine, Calif.
Paragon Software Group today announced its selection to CIO Review Magazine ’s 2015 list of the 20 Most Promising Disaster Recovery Solution Providers, highlighting the innovation, customer impact and value of the Paragon Protect & Restore (PPR) backup and recovery offering.
The elite annual list, which honors top technology entrepreneurs and innovators in the backup and recovery market, is chosen by a panel of experts and members of CIO Review’s editorial board.
“Paragon Software has been on our radar for some time now for challenging the status quo in the disaster recovery space, and we are happy to showcase them this year due to their continuing excellence in delivering top-notch offerings,” said Jeevan George, Managing Editor, CIO Review. “With PPR, Paragon Software continued to break new ground within the past year, benefiting its customers around the globe. We’re pleased to have them featured on our top companies list in a highly competitive year.”
Paragon’s selection to the prestigious list comes following a record year for the company in which it successfully expanded its market footprint, driving revenue increases of over 21% in 2014 with 2015 shaping up to be even better, according to Tom Fedro, President, Paragon Software Group Corp.
“We have focused our efforts on delivering robust backup and disaster recovery technology in combination with streamlined sales motions and the right mix of marketing and demand generation for our channel partners, along with the backing of our elite U.S.-based engineering, support and technical resources,” said Fedro. “Having CIO Review recognize our work and contributions to the market in 2015 is extremely gratifying, and we’d like to thank them for including Paragon and PPR in their prestigious list.”
PPR offers robust, high performance backup and recovery capabilities for physical servers, virtual hosts and workstations; all in a single centrally managed solution. Ideal for IT professionals who manage infrastructures of all sizes – from one server to thousands – the software offers agent-based and agentless data protection options, along with no-hassle, set-it-and-forget-it configuration and operation.
Resellers interested in more information on PPR or on Paragon’s Pure Channel partner program may visit http://paragon-downloads.com/partners/ or call 888.347.5462.
About CIO Review
CIO Review constantly endeavors to identify "The Best" in a variety of areas important to tech business. Through nominations and consultations with industry leaders, our editors choose the best in different domains. Manufacturing Special edition is an annual listing of 20 Most Promising Manufacturing Tech Solution Providers in the U.S.
About Paragon Software Group
Paragon Software Group is an innovative software developer focused on two dynamic growth markets. The company’s comprehensive product line for the data storage market addresses the needs of data security, storage and management for PCs, servers and networks. A second portfolio of products focuses on mobile productivity applications for handheld devices. Founded in 1994, Paragon Software Group has offices in the USA, Germany, Japan, Poland, Russia and China, delivering its solutions to consumers, small business and enterprise clients worldwide through a network of Value Added Resellers, distributors and OEMs as well as online through the company website. Paragon Software Group provides technology to a host of world-class companies and partners, including Cisco Systems, Dell, HP, Western Digital Corp., ASUS, Seagate, Toshiba, LG Electronics, Logitech, Buffalo, Acer, EMC/Iomega, Siemens, Lenovo, Microsoft, Motorola, Nokia, and more. For more information, please visit the company website at http://www.paragon-software.com .
